column1: He read the letters. One was very unpleasant
column2: from a merchant who was buying a forest on his wife's property. To sell this forest was absolutely essential; but at present
column3: until he was reconciled with his wife
column4: the subject could not be discussed. The most unpleasant thing of all was that his pecuniary interests should in this way enter into the question of his reconciliation with his wife. And the idea that he might be led on by his interests
column5: that he might seek a reconciliation with his wife on account of the sale of the forest—that idea hurt him.When he had finished his letters
column6: Stepan Arkadyevitch moved the office-papers close to him
column7: rapidly looked through two pieces of business
column8: made a few notes with a big pencil
column10: turned to his coffee. As he sipped his coffee
column11: he opened a still damp morning paper
